nodes.bodyText: it was bugging me that I couldn't collapse stuff. I can revert this if you, esteemed reviewer, would prefer.
this is also largely a whitespace change
forgot to put this in the last PR - so putting it here

I'd add a type annotation for the function param at least. Even better, a one-line comment describing the 'helpContent' parameter and why it's needed.
[optional] If you're game for as mass-rename, I think s/helpContent/helpContentKey/ in this file would help reduce confusion throughout, since AFAICT this is really a key into the foreign JSON file which contains the actual content.

[opt] Magic string code smell – for safety, it may help to break this out into a top-level constant, with a comment clarifying that it needs to match the strings used in app/app-routing-module.ts and assets/json/help-sidebar.json.
I also would love to see a comment here clarifying why we switch to a folder icon when the "notebookStorage" help content is being displayed. Something to the effect of "Because the 'notebookStorage' help text is about workspace storage, we switch the icon to be a folder instead of a question mark."
(Unrelated comment: do we know of any technical reason why we are loading the help-sidebar content via a static JSON file rather than including it as an object within our Typescript code? The latter approach would add some level of type safety and would keep the content closer to the code which uses it.)
I don't know of any technical reason why we're loading the content this way, aside from that the content is not really code. I'm sure there's some historical thing lost to the centuries.
